title: Senior Development Engineer
summary: Supervised a team, wrote code, and handled build/server administration for AWS infrastructure.
responsibilities: Machine learning: maintained existing models and developed new models (scikit-learn, including random forest); used pandas for data processing and reporting.
Architecture: evaluated options and delivered proofs of concept for developers to implement; researched and migrated components (e.g., SQS to Redis, Celery to AWS Step Functions).
Infrastructure as code: replaced manual server rebuilds with Ansible-based builds.
Build engineering: wrote a comprehensive bash build script, later rewrote it in Python to overcome bash limitations.
Maintenance development: split a monolith into five components, including two Swagger REST API microservices running on Docker.
Cloud administration: administered ~30–60 AWS servers (mostly Ubuntu, sometimes CentOS/RHEL); cost optimization, network hardening, VPC migrations, user and API key management.
Supervision: managed 1–5 developers; supported three codebases; shipped two major versions; cut AWS bills and handled operational requests; supervised a DevOps engineer and temporary dev team.
